answerText: Franz Kafka[10] In this Kafka story, an officer complains to an explorer about his Commandant's lack of interest in the execution machine that he eventually sets to carve "be just" into himself.
heading: Missiles of October |2011 | 1 | 15 | Literature | European | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: In one story by this man, a performer is upset by his public's unwillingness to believe his acts. For 10 points each: [10] Name this author of "A Hunger Artist" and a work in which Gregor Samsa awakes from unsettling dreams to find he has undergone "The Metamorphosis."
